p: Winged bean contains many anti-nutritional factors: trypsin inhibitors, chymotrypsin inhibitors (WCI), hemagglutinins, amylase inhibitors, phytates, phytic acid, flatulence factors, hydrogen cyanide, saponins, tannins and other phenolic compounds [ 35, 36]. Table 2 shows the main phytochemicals of Psophocarpus tetragonolubs responsible of its anti-oxidant and anti-inflammatory activities.
